doc.title: Adapters
doc.paragraph: This chapter goes over the various Adapters, how and when each should be used, and how to configure them.

section.title: Adaptive Framework Core
section.paragraph: This adapter is a special adapter, because it always exists and there is only one instance of its type. This adapter is provided by the Adaptive Framework Core and uses the adapterId of "afw". It presents objects that have been compiled into memory and also generates runtime objects that exist from configurations and environment. Objects from the Core adapter are read-only.

section.title: File
section.paragraph: This adapter allows adaptive objects to be stored in the native file system as directories and files.

section.title: LDAP
section.paragraph: This adapter provides access to adaptive objects stored in Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) compliant databases.

section.title: LMDB
section.paragraph: This adapter allows adaptive objects to be stored in the memory-mapped key-value database, LMDB.

section.title: Model
section.paragraph: This is a special adapter that's used to support mapping objects based on model adaptive object types to one or more objects from another adapter.

section.title: VFS
section.paragraph: This adapter allows you to access files as objects through a Virtual File System.
